------------------------------

GENESIS

------------------------------

Gene Kerman nervously rapped his fingers against the console. Questions flew through his mind relentlessly: What if the stage separation system failed? What if the parachute failed to deploy? What if there was a breach in the capsule? He had planned, checked; double-checked. Had interns go and check his checking. Had interns check their checking by jumping off the roof of the newly commissioned Ã¢â‚¬ËœVehicle Assembly BuildingÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ with a scale model of the parachute, and had their replacements discard that work and correct the errors. But still, there was a nagging doubt that somewhere, he had forgotten something.

Ã¢â‚¬ËœWe are closing on terminal count. All controllers to station. Gene, you have the ball.Ã¢â‚¬â„¢

He snapped out of his trance. It would work, he told himself. It had to. The future of the program depended on it. He had lobbied for months for a program of this nature, and he couldnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t well lose his bottle at this point. Rising from his chair, he cleared his throat.

Ã¢â‚¬ËœAll stations, this is Gene. We are holding at 300 seconds. Give me go-no-go for count. Booster?Ã¢â‚¬â„¢

Ã¢â‚¬ËœGo.Ã¢â‚¬â„¢ Ã¢â‚¬ËœFIDO?Ã¢â‚¬â„¢

Ã¢â‚¬ËœGo flight.Ã¢â‚¬â„¢ Ã¢â‚¬Ëœ RETRO?Ã¢â‚¬â„¢

Ã¢â‚¬ËœWeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re go, Gene.Ã¢â‚¬â„¢ Ã¢â‚¬ËœRange?Ã¢â‚¬â„¢

Ã¢â‚¬ËœAll clear, go flight.Ã¢â‚¬â„¢ Ã¢â‚¬ËœCAPCOM?Ã¢â‚¬â„¢

Ã¢â‚¬ËœGo.Ã¢â‚¬â„¢ Ã¢â‚¬ËœSnacks?Ã¢â‚¬â„¢

Ã¢â‚¬ËœGo for flight.Ã¢â‚¬â„¢

Ã¢â‚¬ËœAll stations are go for flight. Commence terminal count. HowÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re you feeling, Jeb?Ã¢â‚¬â„¢

Out on the pad, Jeb cleared his throat. He shouldnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t be nervous at all. He had trained for what felt like years, committing hundreds of hours to simulators and advanced jet aircraft, set up to help with G-loading. He was a stone-cold fighter-pilot, with combat experience and a golden record for pulling it together when the odds looked impossible. And yet, this was completely unknown to him. No one had done this before, which was exactly why he had volunteered for the selection, and why he was thrilled to be the first. Through all of that though, he still found a cold bead of sweat forming on his brow as the count commenced. Gene had said something to him. He didnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t know what; all his focus was on the panel of lights and switched presented before him. He opened his mouth to speak, perhaps saying something poetic to encapsulate the moment. But all he could find himself thinking was, Ã¢â‚¬ËœletÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s go already.Ã¢â‚¬â„¢

Ã¢â‚¬ËœAll stations, we are go in t-minus 10 seconds.Ã¢â‚¬â„¢

Gene looked out of the control room. Through the window he could see the rocket, built by the newly-formed Ã¢â‚¬ËœUnited Launch ConglomerateÃ¢â‚¬â„¢. They had been selected to design this new machine, and Gene hoped that he had chosen well. A silence swept over as the countdown continued.

Ã¢â‚¬Ëœ5 seconds. 4.Ã¢â‚¬â„¢

Everything was silent.

Ã¢â‚¬ËœMain engine start. Two. One.Ã¢â‚¬â„¢

A cloud engulfed the pad, throwing stones and scattering the local wildlife. The wall of sound was immense. Everybody held their breath.

Then, a point of light burst through the apex, screaming upwards.

Ã¢â‚¬ËœLiftoff! we are go for Pioneer! Liftoff of the first manned space flight!Ã¢â‚¬â„¢

Everybody broke into rapturous applause. Gene couldnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t help it; he laughed. It worked! It was far from a success yet, but as the rocket arced out over the bay, breaking through the cloud layer, he couldnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t help but smile to himself. It was all up from here.

Edited December 12, 2014 by Capt-Coulson
Fixed title in place.
First post reserved. For stuff. And things.

If you don't have a mission report... don't post a thread. It clutters the forums and takes up space. If you forget about the report, then this thread just stays here (until of course a mod or admin locks or deletes it). I also see this is your first post here on the forums. Welcome!! May I direct you towards the forum rules and also the good conduct guide.
Hi. Literally editing now. I was just too excited to post!

It was all up from here.

Well, until Jeb has to come back down at least. Nice start! Welcome to the forums!
Nice read, I hope you keep adding more stories

Well, until Jeb has to come back down at least. Nice start! Welcome to the forums!

Thanks! I have to say that Ad Lunam inspired me to start this. I like the style in which you approach writing up the reports. Rep to you sir (now that I'm a forumer )!
It was a nice beginning, but you should at least post a close-up of the rocket before\during the lift-off. Streak of smoke and the Sun? Pretty, but not very informative.
